Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, interior spotted with a black resinous deposit, exterior covered with a red-brown slip and remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.97)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87603) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87603)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 105 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
